intro: Trimelopter, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Trimelopter is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
